required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Conventional Photodynamic Therapy vs. Painless Photodynamic Therapy for Small Genital Warts
clinical_study.official_title: Conventional Photodynamic Therapy vs. Painless Photodynamic Therapy for Small Genital Warts：a Randomized, Open-label Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to compare a new, continuous illumination and short Incubation time regimen of aminolevulinic acid photodynamic therapy（ALA-PDT) to a conventional regimen for treatment of small genital warts. The hypothesis is that the continuous illumination approach will be less or even no painful, but equally efficacious, as the old regimen.

study_design_info.masking_description: Evaluator assesses photographs without prior knowledge of intervention

primary_outcome.measure: The clearance rate of Genital Warts
primary_outcome.time_frame: one week after the last treatment
primary_outcome.description: The clearance rate of Genital Warts will be measured at one week after the last treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately, 1st minute, 3rd minute, 5th minute, 7th minute, 10th minute , and every 10 minute to the end of treatment and 2 hours, 12 hours, 24hours and 48 hours after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The pain will be assessed using Visual Analogue Scale（VAS) with a score range of 0-10. The higher the score, the greater the pain, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the most unbearable pain. Pain will be measured at different time points during and after every treatment ，including immediately, 1st min, 3rd min, 5th min, 7th min, 10th min , and every 10 min to the end of treatment and 2nd h, 12th h, 24th h and 48th h after treatment.
The recurrence rates will be measured at 3 months after the last treatment.

arm_group.description: The painless photodynamic therapy（P-PDT）group underwent narrow-band light-emitting diode (LED) irradiation (630 nm; 400 J/cm2) after applying 20% 5-aminolevulinic acid（ALA）cream for 30min. A repeat treatment was administered once weekly for a maximum of 3 weeks.

The conventional photodynamic therapy(C-PDT) group underwent narrow-band light-emitting diode (LED) irradiation (630 nm; 100 J/cm2) after applying 20% 5-aminolevulinic acid cream for 3h.A repeat treatment was administered once weekly for a maximum of 3 weeks.

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: One year after finishing this study and for permanency
